ca.uqac.lif.cep.functions

Class FunctionProcessor

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.uqac.lif.cep.Processor
      • ca.uqac.lif.cep.SingleProcessor
        • ca.uqac.lif.cep.functions.FunctionProcessor
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Contextualizable, Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConstantProcessor, CumulativeProcessor

    public class FunctionProcessor
extends SingleProcessor
    Applies a function to input events to produce output events. This class provides a way to "lift" any m-to-n function into an m-to-n processor, by simply calling the function on the inputs to produce the outputs.
    Author:
    Sylvain Hall√©

    • Method Detail

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Description copied from class: Processor
        Resets the processor. This has for effect of flushing the contents of all input and output event queues. If the processor has an internal state, this should also reset this state to its "initial" settings (whatever that means in your context).
        Overrides:
        reset in class Processor

      • compute

        protected Queue<Object[]> compute(Object[] inputs)
        Description copied from class: SingleProcessor
        Computes one or more output events from its input events
        Specified by:
        compute in class SingleProcessor
        Parameters:
        inputs - An array of input events; its length corresponds to the processor's input arity
        Returns:
        A queue of vectors of output events, or null if no event could be produced

      • clone

        Specified by:

      • getInputTypesFor

        public final void getInputTypesFor(Set<Class<?>> classes,
                                   int index)
        Description copied from class: Processor
        Populates the set of classes accepted by the processor for its i-th input.

        By default, a processor returns the Connector.Variant type for all its inputs and all its outputs, meaning that the checking of types in Connector.connect(Processor...) will be skipped. A descendant of this class may choose to define specific types for its input and output, thereby activating runtime type checking.

        Overrides:
        getInputTypesFor in class Processor
        Parameters:
        classes - The set of to fill with classes
        index - The index of the input to query

      • getOutputTypeFor

        public final Class<?> getOutputTypeFor(int index)
        Description copied from class: Processor
        Returns the type of the events produced by the processor for its i-th output.

        By default, a processor returns the Connector.Variant type for all its inputs and all its outputs, meaning that the checking of types in Connector.connect(Processor...) will be skipped. A descendant of this class may choose to define specific types for its input and output, thereby activating runtime type checking.

        Overrides:
        getOutputTypeFor in class Processor
        Parameters:
        index - The index of the output to query
        Returns:
        The type of the output
